description.narrative:
IntraHealth provides ongoing human resources for health and family planning technical content and expertise. IntraHealth also supported the development of K4Health’s gender strategy and works to ensure that gender (specifically gender for human resources for health) is considered in K4Health products and tools.
In collaboration with K4Health’s Global Health eLearning Center (GHeL), IntraHealth is involved in the following activities: • Facilitating an online discussion between learners and the course author for the GheL Gender and Health Systems Strengthening course • Supporting revisions for GHeL family planning course content • Planning an interactive voice response (IVR) course for GHeL family planning content in East Africa
With the West African Health Organization (WAHO), IntraHealth activities include: • Presenting at the DHIS2 & iHRIS Interoperability Academy in Monrovia, Liberia, collaborating to lead sessions on data use for family planning • Collaborating to conduct a knowledge management and information and communication technology assessment to improve internal and external knowledge management and communications
Other activities include: • Participating and presenting at the East Africa Share Fair, a regional knowledge management event to share best practices in family planning program implementation • Planning an Asia Share Fair to coincide with the 2015 International Conference on Family Planning • Leading a knowledge management assessment for the Ouagadougou Partnership Coordinating Unit to identify ways to strengthen sharing of family planning knowledge and resources • Supporting the Idea Lab, a K4Health platform created to solicit feedback directly from users of the project’s products and services

The Knowledge for Health (K4Health) Project is the flagship health knowledge management project of USAID’s Office of Population and Reproductive Health. K4Health is implemented by the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health’s Center for Communication Programs, FHI 360, IntraHealth International, and Management Sciences for Health, in collaboration with a host of other partners around the world. The project inherits a rich store of expertise and resources from predecessor projects going back nearly 40 years.
K4Health meets the knowledge needs of health program managers and health service providers, both directly and via capacity strengthening of institutions and organizations. K4Health strategically connects people, institutions, ideas, and technical information, focusing on creating and continually improving platforms, products, and services that support knowledgeable program managers and service providers. This is accomplished through capture and synthesis of evidence as well as other knowledge management techniques such as knowledge generation, curation, and dissemination.
